PageTitle: tunnel-detect-delay (VPN instance IPv4 address family MVPN view)
FuncDef:
The tunnel-detect-delay command configures the tunnel status check to be delayed by a specified period of time when the bearer tunnel of VPN instance multicast data changes.
The undo tunnel-detect-delay command restores the default configuration.
By default, the tunnel status check is delayed by 5s when the bearer tunnel of VPN instance multicast data changes.
ParentView: VPN instance IPv4 address family MVPN view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a delay for the tunnel status check.
The value is an integer ranging from 3 to 60, in seconds.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In RSVP-TE P2MP tunnel dual-root 1+1 protection scenarios, multicast data may be switched from the primary inclusive-provider multicast service interface (I-PMSI) tunnel to the backup I-PMSI tunnel if the selective-provider multicast service interface (S-PMSI) tunnel is not ready during data switching. To solve this problem, start a tunnel status check delay timer on leaf PEs:
Before the timer expires, leaf PEs delete tunnel protection groups to skip the status check of the primary I-PMSI or S-PMSI tunnel.After the timer expires, leaf PEs start to check the primary I-PMSI or S-PMSI tunnel status again.
The tunnel-detect-delay command allows you to configure the value of the tunnel status check delay timer.

Configuration Impact
If the tunnel-detect-delay command is run more than once, the latest configuration overrides the previous one.
